Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2012 09:19AM JMW wrote: I started the FEC-D last December. I felt extremely ill after my first one for about 3 days. Decided I wasn't going back! But like I say it only lasted 3 days. The following ones barely effected me at all. Made sure I took all my anti-nausea meds and drank lots of water. I had lots of annoying side effects the following treatments but nowhere near as bad as my first treatment. When I started the "D" I didn't feel sick at all.....just unbelieveably tired. I could barely make it up my stairs. That went on for a few weeks after I finished. I am a year out now and I feel pretty much back to normal with about 3 inches of hair. Oh, my hair started falling out after my second treatment and my scalp was really sensitive so I got my sister to shave it all off. One more thing.....stay away from sick people!  Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: Have you had the FEC -D protocol? VeronicaX VeronicaX

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2012 08:23PM JMW wrote: Oh....one more thing. This last post reminded me, as I seem to need a lot of these days.... I wore ice gloves on my hands during the "D" part of my treatment to protect my fingernails. Very uncomfortable but I knew I wouldn't be able to go back to work if my fingers were numb and so on. It worked very well for me. No numbness (neuropathy) or nail loss.  I did however get numbness in my toes and both my big toes and baby toes lost their nails. The reason I mentioned staying away from sick people is because your white blood cell count gets very low on the "D". I got a fever and ended up in the hospital in isolation for 6 days. Mind you it was worth it lol. Most peace and rest I got through my whole treatment!
Posts.Title: Have you had the FEC -D protocol? VeronicaX VeronicaX

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2010 07:54AM - edited Dec 30, 2011 09:37PM by JMW Hi everyone, I guess I'm a little a head of you. I had my first chemo Dec. 21st. I go for my next one Jan. 11. I don't even know what to say! 2 days after my treatment I felt like I was dying and on my way to hell! After 3 days of that I woke up and felt almost completely normal. It was amazing. I had no idea what to expect....I had come to the conclusion that I would never make it through this. But am now more determined than ever. Not trying to scare anyone but wish someone would have told me that it actually does come to an end. Have gotten used to the idea of losing my hair. Should all be gone just in time for my 52nd. birthday in January.  I have been trying to prepare my young sons for this by sketching pictures of myself bald. They think I look beautiful!! lol Good luck to all.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2011 09:15AM - edited Dec 30, 2011 09:46PM by JMW I also had a hard time trying to figure out how to tell my sons. (9yrs. and 13yrs) But everyone on here convinced me it would be best to tell them before my hair started falling out and I started looking sick (still not there) but my hair is all gone now. Just had my second chemo 6 days ago. I just tried to explain to them that it was the cure making me look so odd not the illness. I also sketched pictures of myself with no hair before I lost it so they'd have an idea of what I'd look like. When they finally saw me with no hair their eyes kind of widened but they didn't really say much. My youngest son just asked me if it hurt! Good luck to you.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2010 08:05AM - edited Dec 30, 2011 09:38PM by JMW Oh and by the way, I am getting 3 treatments of FEC and then 3 treatments of D. After that I have 21 days of radiation. Haven't really noticed anyone else with this cocktail? Will have to look up what this stuff  you ladies are getting.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward
Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2011 11:06AM JMW wrote: Hi Kennylynne, my eyelashes and brows started coming back  within a couple of weeks of finishing my chemo. My lashes came back very full and longer than they were. I have had friends ask me if I'm wearing falsies! I have seen lots of women say they fell out 2 and 3 different times but that didn't happen to me. They came and they stayed! Be patient, it doesn't take long. There is nothing vain about it, I wore eyeliner everyday so it would look like I had eyelashes whether I was going anywhere or not. lol
Posts.Title: Hair loss and regrowth kennylynne hakeemshahnawazanddoctors

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2010 10:44PM JMW wrote: Sorry, don't know where I got that 16 weeks of radiation!!!! My brain is not working these days...it's actually 3 weeks of radiation and I can come home on weekends. So it is the Canadian protocol. (Think I was counting the days).
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2010 11:09AM JMW wrote: Hi seyla888, I am travelling because the closest city where I can get my rad treatment is a 2 hr. drive. To get there I have to drive through a mountain pass. Weather can get pretty nasty up there in the winter months and sometimes they have to close the highway. The  dr. doesn't want to take any chances that I might miss some of my treatments. Wow, all the replies I have received about when to tell my sons about my cancer kind of surprised me! Certainly has me re-thinking. Someone on here mentioned (sorry, can't remember the name, it was on another thread) that before Xmas would be a better time to tell them with a great distraction like Xmas coming. I think maybe I agree with that. Just have to think about it a little more. Thanks ladies. Hi onestep, my sons are 13 and 9 years old.
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2010 11:20PM JMW wrote: Hi, my name is Jeannie,  I believe I am stage 1 but not absolutely sure. IDC but don't even know the grade.  I  had a lumpectomy 3 weeks ago but have not been told if the margins were clean.  Still have not heard anything back from my sentinel node biopsy or my MRI.....both 10 days ago. I do know I go to Victoria in January to start my 16 weeks of radiation therapy. Will miss my kids but can come home on weekends.  Will be glad to get all my information. Everyone here seems so informed with what's going on, I really feel in the dark here. Have called my onc. twice in the last 10 days but won't talk to me till he has all my test results back. I know he just wants to be able to give me an accurate and final diagnosis.  One more thing.... I have breast implants, under the muscle so the lumpectomy didn't affect it. I still don't even know if I have to have the implant removed! Anyone else?? Thanks for any replies. Oh and by the way, I hate pink too!
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker
